eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu

Class GuildOverviewMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.GuildOverviewMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class GuildOverviewMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Sub menu of the main menu, that is used for viewing your guild and interacting with guild buildings.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    GuildApplicationMenu

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuildOverviewMenu

        public GuildOverviewMenu()

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the menu for the given player. If the player isn't already in a guild an overview of random guilds and an instruction to create your own are shown. If you are in a guild, there will be a display showing the guild's name, leader, member count, description and commands. There is always the option to select your own tabard, or create a custom one, for your guild, if you are a guild officer. There is also a list of upgradable buildings, shown for your guild, including the enterable guildhall. Officers also have the option to view applications to the guild. A list of guild members, including last online time and character stats, can also be used to pro- or demote members.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerGuild.getGuilds(), WauzPlayerGuild.getGuildName(), WauzPlayerGuild.getAdminUuidString(), WauzPlayerGuild.getMemberUuidStrings(), WauzPlayerGuild.getMemberAmount(), WauzPlayerGuild.getApplicationCount(), WauzPlayerGuild.getWrappedGuildDescription(), WauzPlayerGuild.getGuildTabard(), PlayerConfigurator.getLastPlayed(OfflinePlayer), PlayerConfigurator.getRaceString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getWorldString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getLevelString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getSurvivalScore(OfflinePlayer)

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. Cancels the event and initiates the corresponding guild interaction. If the tabard is left clicked, the selection will be shown, or it can be edited if it was a right click. A click on the application item opens the list of guild applications for officers. A right click on the guild hall teleports the player inside. A click on the barrier lets the player leave the guild. A click on a guild banner in the guild list, sents a guild application to them. Clicking on player heads in the member list can open a pro- or demote dialog, based on permissions.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        TabardMenu.open(Player), TabardBuilder.open(Player), GuildApplicationMenu.open(Player), InstanceManager.enterGuild(Player), WauzPlayerEventGuildLeave, WauzPlayerGuild.applyForGuild(Player, String), WauzPlayerEventGuildDemoteMember, WauzPlayerEventGuildKick, WauzPlayerEventGuildPromoteOfficer, WauzPlayerEventGuildPromoteLeader

      • validateOfficerAccess

        public static boolean validateOfficerAccess(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                            WauzPlayerGuild playerGuild)
        Checks if the given player is a guild officer or higher.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check.
        playerGuild - The guild of the player.
        Returns:
        If the player is a guild officer.
